content:
TITLE: Multi-stage Dockerfile Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Complex example showing development, CI, and production configurations in a single Dockerfile using multi-stage builds.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/2.installing-additional-php-extensions.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
############################################
# Base Image
############################################

# Learn more about the Server Side Up PHP Docker Images at:
# https://serversideup.net/open-source/docker-php/
FROM serversideup/php:8.4-fpm-nginx AS base

# Switch to root before installing our PHP extensions
USER root
RUN install-php-extensions bcmath gd

############################################
# Development Image
############################################
FROM base AS development

# We can pass USER_ID and GROUP_ID as build arguments
# to ensure the www-data user has the same UID and GID
# as the user running Docker.
ARG USER_ID
ARG GROUP_ID

# Switch to root so we can set the user ID and group ID
USER root
RUN docker-php-serversideup-set-id www-data $USER_ID:$GROUP_ID  && \
    docker-php-serversideup-set-file-permissions --owner $USER_ID:$GROUP_ID --service nginx

# Switch back to the unprivileged www-data user
USER www-data

############################################
# CI image
############################################
FROM base AS ci

# Sometimes CI images need to run as root
# so we set the ROOT user and configure
# the PHP-FPM pool to run as www-data
USER root
RUN echo "user = www-data" >> /usr/local/etc/php-fpm.d/docker-php-serversideup-pool.conf && \
    echo "group = www-data" >> /usr/local/etc/php-fpm.d/docker-php-serversideup-pool.conf

############################################
# Production Image
############################################
FROM base AS deploy
COPY --chown=www-data:www-data . /var/www/html
USER www-data
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Docker Compose for Laravel Horizon
DESCRIPTION: Example Docker Compose configuration for running Laravel Horizon with Redis. It includes service definitions for PHP, Redis, and Horizon, with specific settings for graceful shutdown and health checks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/4.laravel/4.laravel-horizon.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  php:
    image: my/laravel-app

  redis:
    image: redis:6
    command: "redis-server --appendonly yes --requirepass redispassword"

  horizon:
    image: my/laravel-app
    command: ["php", "/var/www/html/artisan", "horizon"]
    stop_signal: SIGTERM # Set this for graceful shutdown if you're using fpm-apache or fpm-nginx
    healthcheck:
      # This is our native healthcheck script for Horizon
      test: ["CMD", "healthcheck-horizon"]
      start_period: 10s
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Laravel Queue in Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: A simplified Docker Compose configuration for running a Laravel application with a separate queue worker. It demonstrates how to set up the queue service, including the command, stop signal, and healthcheck.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/4.laravel/3.laravel-queue.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  php:
    image: my/laravel-app

  queue:
    image: my/laravel-app
    command: ["php", "/var/www/html/artisan", "queue:work", "--tries=3"]
    stop_signal: SIGTERM # Set this for graceful shutdown if you're using fpm-apache or fpm-nginx
    healthcheck:
      # This is our native healthcheck script for the queue
      test: ["CMD", "healthcheck-queue"]
      start_period: 10s
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Docker Compose Configuration for Laravel with Reverb
DESCRIPTION: An example Docker Compose configuration that sets up both a Laravel application container and a separate Reverb container with Traefik routing labels. The configuration includes proper healthchecks and stop signals for graceful shutdown.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/4.laravel/4.laravel-reverb.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  php:
    image: my/laravel-app
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.laravel.tls=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.laravel.entrypoints=websecure"
      - "traefik.http.routers.laravel.rule=Host(`https://app.example.com`)"
      - "traefik.http.services.laravel.loadbalancer.server.port=8080"
      - "traefik.http.services.laravel.loadbalancer.server.scheme=http"

  reverb:
    image: my/laravel-app
    command: ["php", "/var/www/html/artisan", "--port=8000", "reverb:start"]
    stop_signal: SIGTERM # Set this for graceful shutdown if you're using fpm-apache or fpm-nginx
    healthcheck:
      # This is our native healthcheck script for Reverb
      test: ["CMD", "healthcheck-reverb"]
      start_period: 10s
    labels:
      - "traefik.enable=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.reverb.tls=true"
      - "traefik.http.routers.reverb.entrypoints=websecure"
      - "traefik.http.routers.reverb.rule=Host(`https://reverb.example.com`)"
      - "traefik.http.services.reverb.loadbalancer.server.port=8000"
      - "traefik.http.services.reverb.loadbalancer.server.scheme=http"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Multi-stage Dockerfile for Different Environments with v3 Images
DESCRIPTION: Example Dockerfile that creates multiple build targets (base, development, CI, and production) using the v3 PHP images. Includes proper user permission handling for each environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/3.guide/100.migrating-from-v2-to-v3.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
############################################
# Base Image
############################################

# Learn more about the Server Side Up PHP Docker Images at:
# https://serversideup.net/open-source/docker-php/
FROM serversideup/php:8.4-fpm-nginx AS base

## Uncomment if you need to install additional PHP extensions
# USER root
# RUN install-php-extensions bcmath gd

############################################
# Development Image
############################################
FROM base AS development

# We can pass USER_ID and GROUP_ID as build arguments
# to ensure the www-data user has the same UID and GID
# as the user running Docker.
ARG USER_ID
ARG GROUP_ID

# Switch to root so we can set the user ID and group ID
USER root
RUN docker-php-serversideup-set-id www-data $USER_ID:$GROUP_ID  && \
    docker-php-serversideup-set-file-permissions --owner $USER_ID:$GROUP_ID --service nginx
USER www-data

############################################
# CI image
############################################
FROM base AS ci

# Sometimes CI images need to run as root
# so we set the ROOT user and configure
# the PHP-FPM pool to run as www-data
USER root
RUN echo "user = www-data" >> /usr/local/etc/php-fpm.d/docker-php-serversideup-pool.conf && \
    echo "group = www-data" >> /usr/local/etc/php-fpm.d/docker-php-serversideup-pool.conf

############################################
# Production Image
############################################
FROM base AS deploy
COPY --chown=www-data:www-data . /var/www/html
USER www-data
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Docker Compose for Laravel Task Scheduler
DESCRIPTION: A simplified Docker Compose configuration showing how to set up a dedicated container for running Laravel's schedule:work command with proper health checks and graceful shutdown settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/4.laravel/2.laravel-task-scheduler.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  php:
    image: my/laravel-app

  task:
    image: my/laravel-app
    command: ["php", "/var/www/html/artisan", "schedule:work"]
    stop_signal: SIGTERM # Set this for graceful shutdown if you're using fpm-apache or fpm-nginx
    healthcheck:
      # This is our native healthcheck script for the scheduler
      test: ["CMD", "healthcheck-schedule"]
      start_period: 10s
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Docker Compose for Development with Host User IDs
DESCRIPTION: A Docker Compose configuration that targets the development build and passes the host user's UID and GID as build arguments. This enables seamless file permissions between the container and host system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/3.guide/2.understanding-file-permissions.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  php:
    build:
      context: .
      target: development
      args:
        # UID and GID must be set as environment variables on the host machine
        USER_ID: $UID
        GROUP_ID: $GID
    ports:
      - 80:8080
    volumes:
      - .:/var/www/html
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Docker PHP Container with Dynamic User IDs
DESCRIPTION: A Dockerfile example that creates both development and production targets, where the development target dynamically sets the www-data user's UID/GID to match the host machine's user. This approach maintains container security while solving file permission issues.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/3.guide/2.understanding-file-permissions.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
############################################
# Base Image
############################################
FROM serversideup/php:8.4-fpm-nginx-bookworm AS base

############################################
# Development Image
############################################
FROM base AS development

# Switch to root so we can do root things
USER root

# Save the build arguments as a variable
ARG USER_ID
ARG GROUP_ID

# Use the build arguments to change the UID 
# and GID of www-data while also changing 
# the file permissions for NGINX
RUN docker-php-serversideup-set-id www-data $USER_ID:$GROUP_ID && \
    \
    # Update the file permissions for our NGINX service to match the new UID/GID
    docker-php-serversideup-set-file-permissions --owner $USER_ID:$GROUP_ID --service nginx

# Drop back to our unprivileged user
USER www-data

############################################
# Production Image
############################################

# Since we're calling "base", production isn't
# calling any of that permission stuff
FROM base AS production

# Copy our app files as www-data (33:33)
COPY --chown=www-data:www-data . /var/www/html
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Changing PHP upload size limits using Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration for Docker Compose shows how to set PHP_POST_MAX_SIZE and PHP_UPLOAD_MAX_FILE_SIZE environment variables to increase the maximum upload size to 500MB. It also configures SSL mode and exposes the necessary ports.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/1.changing-common-php-settings.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
version: '3'
services:
  php:
    image: serversideup/php:8.2.12-unit-bookworm
    environment:
      PHP_POST_MAX_SIZE: "500M"
      PHP_UPLOAD_MAX_FILE_SIZE: "500M"
      SSL_MODE: "mixed"
    ports:
      - 80:8080
      - 443:8443
    volumes:
      - .:/var/www/html/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Replacing default PHP configuration in Dockerfile
DESCRIPTION: This Dockerfile extends the base PHP image, removes the default configuration file, and replaces it with a custom one. This approach gives complete control over the PHP configuration without inheriting any default settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/1.changing-common-php-settings.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM serversideup/php:8.4-fpm-nginx-bookworm

RUN rm /usr/local/etc/php/conf.d/serversideup-docker-php.ini
COPY zzz-custom-php.ini /usr/local/etc/php/conf.d/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Custom SSL Certificates in Docker Compose YAML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to provide custom SSL certificates to a Docker service. It sets environment variables for the certificate files and mounts them from a local directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/4.configuring-ssl.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  php:
    image: serversideup/php:8.4-fpm-nginx
    ports:
      - 80:8080
      - 443:8443
    environment:
      SSL_MODE: "mixed"
      SSL_PRIVATE_KEY_FILE: "/etc/ssl/private/test-key.pem"
      SSL_CERTIFICATE_FILE: "/etc/ssl/private/test.pem"
    volumes:
      - ./app:/var/www/html
      - ./certs/:/etc/ssl/private/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding custom PHP configuration in Dockerfile
DESCRIPTION: This Dockerfile extends the base PHP image and copies a custom PHP configuration file to the appropriate directory. The configuration file will be loaded alongside the default settings provided by the base image.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/1.changing-common-php-settings.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM serversideup/php:8.4-fpm-nginx-bookworm

COPY zzz-custom-php.ini /usr/local/etc/php/conf.d/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PHP intl Extension in Dockerfile
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to install the intl PHP extension using install-php-extensions tool while maintaining proper user permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/2.installing-additional-php-extensions.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM serversideup/php:8.2.12-fpm-nginx-bookworm

# Switch to root so we can do root things
USER root

# Install the intl extension with root permissions
RUN install-php-extensions intl

# Drop back to our unprivileged user
USER www-data
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting User and Group ID in Docker PHP
DESCRIPTION: This command sets the user and group ID of a specified user (typically www-data) in the container. It's useful for development environments to match permissions with the host machine's user and group IDs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/7.reference/2.command-reference.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
#  docker-php-serversideup-set-id [username] [uid]:[gid]
docker-php-serversideup-set-id www-data 1000:1000
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PHP Extensions in Docker
DESCRIPTION: This command is a wrapper around docker-php-ext-install from the official PHP Docker images. It simplifies installing PHP extensions with a single command, as demonstrated with the 'intl' extension.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/7.reference/2.command-reference.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
install-php-extensions intl
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring SSL Mode to Mixed in Docker Compose YAML
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set up a Docker service with SSL mode set to 'mixed', allowing both HTTP and HTTPS traffic. It uses the serversideup/php image and exposes ports 80 and 443.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/4.configuring-ssl.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  php:
    image: serversideup/php:8.4-fpm-nginx
    ports:
      - 80:8080
      - 443:8443
    environment:
      SSL_MODE: "mixed"
    volumes:
      - .:/var/www/html
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Dockerfile to Include Custom Entrypoint Scripts
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to modify the Dockerfile to copy custom entrypoint scripts into the container and set appropriate permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/3.adding-your-own-start-up-scripts.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM serversideup/php:8.4-unit

COPY --chmod=755 ./entrypoint.d/ /etc/entrypoint.d/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Custom PHP configuration file
DESCRIPTION: This PHP INI file contains custom settings for mysqli persistent connections and OpCache configuration. The filename starts with 'zzz' to ensure it's loaded last in alphabetical order when PHP reads configuration files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/1.changing-common-php-settings.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: ini
CODE:
```
mysqli.max_persistent = 300
opcache.max_file_size = 10M
opcache.log_verbosity_level = 3
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Laravel Horizon Health Check in Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: A YAML configuration for setting up a Docker health check that monitors Laravel Horizon service using the provided healthcheck-horizon command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/3.guide/3.using-healthchecks-with-laravel.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
healthcheck:
  test: ["CMD", "healthcheck-horizon"]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Laravel Reverb Health Check in Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: A YAML configuration for setting up a Docker health check that monitors Laravel Reverb service using the provided healthcheck-reverb command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/3.guide/3.using-healthchecks-with-laravel.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
healthcheck:
  test: ["CMD", "healthcheck-reverb"]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Manually Updating Alpine-based PHP Docker Images
DESCRIPTION: Example Dockerfile showing how to manually update an Alpine-based serversideup/php image using apk commands. This approach updates all packages and cleans the package cache to maintain an optimized image size.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/2.getting-started/3.upgrade-guide.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM serversideup/php:8.4.1-fpm-nginx-alpine

RUN apk update \
    && apk upgrade \
    && rm -rf /var/cache/apk/*
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Laravel Task Scheduler in Kernel.php (Laravel ‚â§10)
DESCRIPTION: Example implementation of task scheduling in Laravel 10 and earlier versions using the Kernel.php file. Shows how to configure commands to run at specific times with timezone settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/4.laravel/2.laravel-task-scheduler.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php

namespace App\Console;

use Illuminate\Console\Scheduling\Schedule;
use Illuminate\Foundation\Console\Kernel as ConsoleKernel;

class Kernel extends ConsoleKernel
{
    /**
     * The Artisan commands provided by your application.
     *
     * @var array
     */
    protected $commands = [
        //
    ];

    /**
     * Define the application's command schedule.
     *
     * @param  \Illuminate\Console\Scheduling\Schedule  $schedule
     * @return void
     */
    protected function schedule(Schedule $schedule)
    {
        $schedule->command('process:invoices')->daily()->at('02:00')->timezone('America/Chicago');
        $schedule->command('process:latefees')->daily()->at('04:00')->timezone('America/Chicago');
    }

    /**
     * Register the commands for the application.
     *
     * @return void
     */
    protected function commands()
    {
        $this->load(__DIR__.'/Commands');

        require base_path('routes/console.php');
    }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Laravel Task Scheduler in console.php (Laravel ‚â•11)
DESCRIPTION: Example implementation of task scheduling in Laravel 11 and newer versions using the routes/console.php file. Demonstrates how to schedule a database cleanup operation at a specific time with timezone setting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/4.laravel/2.laravel-task-scheduler.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: php
CODE:
```
<?php
 
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\DB;
use Illuminate\Support\Facades\Schedule;
 
Schedule::call(function () {
    DB::table('recent_users')->delete();
})->daily()->at('04:00')->timezone('America/Chicago');
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting PHP timezone with Docker CLI
DESCRIPTION: This bash command demonstrates how to run a PHP Docker container with a specific timezone setting (America/New_York) using the Docker CLI. It maps port 80 to the container's port 8080 and mounts the current directory to /var/www/html.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/1.changing-common-php-settings.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run -d \
  -p 80:8080 \
  -v $(pwd):/var/www/html \
  -e PHP_DATE_TIMEZONE="America/New_York" \
  serversideup/php:8.2.12-fpm-nginx-bookworm
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting File Permissions for Docker Services
DESCRIPTION: This command sets file permissions for a specific service in the container. It's particularly useful in development environments where you need to match user and group IDs with the host machine.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/7.reference/2.command-reference.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Usage: docker-php-serversideup-set-file-permissions --owner USER:GROUP --service SERVICE
docker-php-serversideup-set-file-permissions --owner 1000:1000 --service nginx
```

----------------------------------------

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Laravel Scheduler Health Check in Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: A YAML configuration for setting up a Docker health check that monitors Laravel Scheduler using the provided healthcheck-schedule command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/3.guide/3.using-healthchecks-with-laravel.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
healthcheck:
  test: ["CMD", "healthcheck-schedule"]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Docker PHP FPM-NGINX on Standard Web Ports
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to use Docker's port mapping feature to run the serversideup/php fpm-nginx container on standard HTTP and HTTPS ports (80 and 443) instead of the default unprivileged ports (8080 and 8443).
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/2.getting-started/3.default-configurations.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run -p 80:8080 -p 443:8443 serversideup/php:8.4-fpm-nginx
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Debian Packages in Docker PHP
DESCRIPTION: This command installs packages on Debian-based systems. It detects the operating system type and only proceeds with installation if it's Debian-based, making it useful for multi-OS Dockerfile configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/7.reference/2.command-reference.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Usage: docker-php-serversideup-dep-install-debian [debian-packages]
docker-php-serversideup-dep-install-debian git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PHP imagick Extension in Dockerfile
DESCRIPTION: Example of installing the imagick PHP extension while maintaining proper user permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/2.installing-additional-php-extensions.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM serversideup/php:8.2.12-fpm-nginx-bookworm

# Switch to root so we can do root things
USER root

# Install the imagick extension with root permissions
RUN install-php-extensions imagick

# Drop back to our unprivileged user
USER www-data
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Laravel Queue Health Check in Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: A YAML configuration for setting up a Docker health check that monitors Laravel Queue workers using the provided healthcheck-queue command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/3.guide/3.using-healthchecks-with-laravel.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
healthcheck:
  test: ["CMD", "healthcheck-queue"]
```

TITLE: Pulling Latest PHP 8.3 with FPM-NGINX from GitHub Packages
DESCRIPTION: Command to pull the latest version of PHP 8.3.x running with FPM and NGINX from GitHub Packages registry.

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ghcr.io/serversideup/php:8.3-fpm-nginx
```

TITLE: Creating a Simple Custom Entrypoint Script in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a basic custom entrypoint script that prints a greeting message. The script is named 99-my-script.sh to ensure it runs after default scripts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/3.adding-your-own-start-up-scripts.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
#!/bin/sh
echo "üëã Hello, world!"
```

TITLE: Exploring PHP Docker Image with Bash Shell
DESCRIPTION: Command to run a bash shell in the PHP 8.3 FPM-NGINX container for exploration and debugging purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/2.getting-started/2.installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run --rm --name php -it serversideup/php:8.3-fpm-nginx bash
```

TITLE: Installing PHP Extension Installer in Docker
DESCRIPTION: This helper script simplifies the installation of the PHP extension installer in Docker containers. It accepts a version parameter to specify which version of the installer to use.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/7.reference/2.command-reference.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Usage: docker-php-serversideup-install-php-ext-installer [version]
docker-php-serversideup-install-php-ext-installer 2.2.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Alpine Packages in Docker PHP
DESCRIPTION: This command installs packages on Alpine-based systems. It detects the operating system type and only proceeds with installation if it's Alpine-based, making it useful for multi-OS Dockerfile configurations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/7.reference/2.command-reference.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Usage: docker-php-serversideup-dep-install-alpine [alpine-packages]
docker-php-serversideup-dep-install-alpine git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Docker Image Reference
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to change the base image reference from official PHP image to serversideup/php image. The migration involves simply prepending 'serversideup/' to the existing image name while maintaining the same version and variant tags.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/3.guide/1.migrating-from-official-php-images.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
php:8.4-cli-alpine
```

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
serversideup/php:8.4-cli-alpine
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updated Docker Compose Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Modified Docker Compose configuration using build context for custom Dockerfile.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/2.installing-additional-php-extensions.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  php:
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    volumes:
      - .:/var/www/html/:cached
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up docker-compose.yml for Custom Entrypoint Scripts
DESCRIPTION: Configures the docker-compose.yml file to build the custom image and mount the project directory into the container.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/5.customizing-the-image/3.adding-your-own-start-up-scripts.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  php:
    build:
      context: .
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    ports:
      - 80:8080
    volumes:
      - .:/var/www/html
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Docker PHP Image Pattern
DESCRIPTION: Template pattern for using ServerSideUp PHP Docker images with version and variation specifications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
serversideup/php:{{version}}-{{variation-name}}
```

TITLE: Enabling Laravel Automations in Docker PHP
DESCRIPTION: The Laravel Automations script is disabled by default and can be enabled by setting the AUTORUN_ENABLED environment variable to true. This is recommended for production environments only.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/4.laravel/1.laravel-automations.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
AUTORUN_ENABLED=true
```

TITLE: Using Docker PHP CLI Image
DESCRIPTION: Example of Docker PHP CLI image reference syntax. The default variation uses the latest supported Debian release if no specific variation is specified.

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
cli
```

TITLE: Displaying Project Structure for Custom Entrypoint Script

TITLE: Running Laravel Reverb Command
DESCRIPTION: The standard command to start Laravel Reverb service from within a Laravel application. This is the basic command that will be passed to the Docker container to start the Reverb process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/4.laravel/4.laravel-reverb.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
php artisan reverb:start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling Isolated Laravel Migrations
DESCRIPTION: To enable the --isolated flag for Laravel migrations, which ensures no other containers are running migrations simultaneously, set the AUTORUN_LARAVEL_MIGRATION_ISOLATION environment variable to true. This requires Laravel v9.38.0+ and a database that supports database locks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/4.laravel/1.laravel-automations.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
AUTORUN_LARAVEL_MIGRATION_ISOLATION=true
```

TITLE: Docker PHP Image Tag Format
DESCRIPTION: The standard format for ServerSideUp PHP Docker image tags, showing the registry URL, release prefix, PHP version, variation name, operating system, and GitHub release version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/2.getting-started/2.installation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

CODE:
```
{{registry-url}}/serversideup/php:{{release-prefix}}-{{php-version}}-{{variation-name}}-{{operating-system}}-{{github-release-version}}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Modifying Docker Compose File to Lock v2 Image Version
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to update your docker-compose.yml file to pin to v2.2.1 to prevent automatic upgrades to v3. This ensures stability during migration planning.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/3.guide/100.migrating-from-v2-to-v3.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  php:
    image: serversideup/php:8.2-fpm-nginx
    ports:
      - 80:80
    volumes:
      - .:/var/www/html
```

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
services:
  php:
    image: serversideup/php:8.2-fpm-nginx-v2.2.1
    ports:
      - 80:80
    volumes:
      - .:/var/www/html
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Manually Updating Debian-based PHP Docker Images
DESCRIPTION: Example Dockerfile showing how to manually update a Debian-based serversideup/php image using apt-get. The commands update packages, clean up unnecessary files, and remove cache to optimize the image size.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/2.getting-started/3.upgrade-guide.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM serversideup/php:8.4.1-fpm-nginx

RUN apt-get update \
    && apt-get upgrade -y \
    && apt-get clean \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/* /tmp/* /var/tmp/* /usr/share/doc/*
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running a Test Web Server with Docker PHP
DESCRIPTION: Example command to run a simple container for testing purposes. This mounts the current directory to the container's web root and exposes ports 80 and 443, mapping them to container ports 8080 and 8443 respectively.
SOURCE: https://github.com/serversideup/docker-php/blob/main/docs/content/docs/2.getting-started/7.contributing.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run --rm -v $(pwd):/var/www/html -p 80:8080 -p 443:8443 serversideup/php:8.4-fpm-nginx
```

DESCRIPTION: The file defines a marketing page structure using custom Vue/Nuxt components within markdown frontmatter. Each component is referenced using custom syntax with double colons and empty content blocks.

---

::

::marketing-grid
::

::marketing-optimized
::

::marketing-dev-to-prod
::

::marketing-testimonials
::

::landing-signup
::

::marketing-follow-along
::
